Class SocketHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.SocketHelper

  • public class SocketHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Shared methods for socket operations between the client and server.

    • Method Detail

      • receiveWithTimeout

        public PacketResult receiveWithTimeout(int timeOutCount,
                              java.net.DatagramPacket response,
                              java.net.InetAddress expectedAddress,
                              int expectedPort,
                              int block)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Receive method for the socket that receives the next data packet and compares it to the expected values. Throws exception if one of the values are not what was expected. Socket will time out after 1s. If a timeout occurs the DatagramPacket passed will be resent using the socket. The result returned holds whether the receive was a success or fail and whether the socket timed out on the request. The result also holds the DatagramPacket received from transfer.
        Parameters:
        timeOutCount - Timeouts that have already happened to display in log
        response - DatagramPacket that should be resent on timeout
        expectedAddress - Expected InetAddress that the received packet should be from
        expectedPort - Expected port number that the received packet should be from
        block - Block number that is expected
        Returns:
        PacketResult object that holds the result of the transfer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is a problem with the received data packet

      • sendErrorPacket

        public void sendErrorPacket(byte[] errCode,
                   java.net.InetAddress address,
                   int port,
                   java.lang.Exception cause)
        Creates datagram error packet using the error code and address. Sends the error packet using the socket with the error code provided.
        Parameters:
        errCode - 2 byte Error Code
        address - to send the Error Packet to
        port - port to send Packet to
        cause - cause of the error packet
